# Chapter 295

The notification window materialized before Grid's eyes the moment they broke free from the Blood Field's radius.

> [Your party member Huroi has died.]

Nobody spoke. Vantner kicked at the dirt. Pon stared at his spear like he wanted to snap it in half.

"Shit." Regas spat the word. "There's a day when I have to sacrifice my companion to live."

"This is the result of our lack of power." Zednos adjusted his glasses. "Let's take this opportunity to work harder."

The rest of the party had stopped blaming Grid after the first hour. They understood he hadn't abandoned Huroi out of malice. When viewed objectively, Grid's call had been correct. Brutal, but correct. Thanks to that decision, seven people had survived instead of zero.

*He factored in the boss mechanics and forced that scenario?*

It was the day they realized Grid wasn't just evolving in personality and combat ability. His tactical thinking had sharpened too. From a certain angle, the situation wasn't completely catastrophic.

But Regas kept shaking. His fists clenched and unclenched at his sides.

"It would've been better for all of us to die, rather than sacrificing someone."

Grid knew why Regas felt this way. Back when Grid had been pathetic, selfish, unbearable to work with, Regas had been the only one who showed him respect. The only one who trusted him when everyone else wrote him off. Grid understood Regas' anger.

Understanding didn't mean acceptance.

"If you have time to grumble, kill more monsters." Grid's voice was flat. "We now have to clear four buildings in 23 hours."

"What?" Vantner's head snapped up.

They had been averaging ten hours per building. That was already an improvement. The first two days, they'd needed twelve hours minimum to finish a single structure.

Every building swarmed with powerful vampires. The ones housing two or more True Bloods were particularly vicious. There had been runs where Vantner burned his once-per-two-days invincibility skill just to survive.

Grid was declaring they'd cut that time nearly in half. With one fewer party member. In a twisted way, it proved Grid was the most enraged person present about Huroi's death.

"Look." Vantner stepped forward. "We'll be wiped out if we rush like that. What if we encounter a building with three True Blood vampires and no time to rest?"

"Vantner is correct." Pon tapped his spear against the ground. "We should maintain our previous pace. Grid, I understand your feelings, but don't let rage cloud your judgment."

Jishuka crossed her arms. "No. We have to do as Grid says. Elfin Stone will come for us again tomorrow."

Peak Sword nodded. "If Grid doesn't reach level 300 by then, this situation will repeat itself."

The goal crystallized in the silence that followed.

"More haste, more speed." Grid strode toward the next building. "We have to hurry."

He entered through the main entrance and immediately activated **Transcend**, aiming at the ceiling.

**Kurururung!**

The roof collapsed. Dust billowed through the hall in choking clouds.

**Bump!**

**Kung! Kung!**

Stone rubble piled high across the floor.

**Kwaang!**

**Kwang! Kwang!**

The coffins in the collapsed section burst open simultaneously. Hundreds of vampires spilled out, their eyes glowing red in the darkness as they scanned for the source of the disturbance.

"Who dares awaken us from our sleep?" one snarled.

"These human scum want to die!"

"No." Grid gripped Failure in his right hand and the Doppelganger's Greatsword in his left. His expression was carved from ice. "I want to kill you."

*I'm angry.*

His party members were here risking their lives to help him complete his quest. His helplessness made him sick.

"I..."

Grid charged forward. There was no hesitation, no defensive positioning. The red glow from the Slaughterer's Eye Patch cut through the gloom like a beacon.

"I'm going to become stronger!"

Strong enough that this filthy, hollow feeling would never poison him again. He would become the best. Grid finally understood what he needed from this game. Combat experience. Levels. Instinct. And the overwhelming power that only perfect items could provide.

"Ohhhhhh!"

Grid crashed into the center of the vampire horde. In the darkness, Failure and Grid's Boots amplified his stats significantly. He fought better now than he ever had before entering these cursed cities.

He'd been struggling against large groups all day and had grown more efficient with every encounter. But he needed to stay calm. Needed to maintain composure.

"Kek! Ugh! H-Hik! Save me!"

"..."

Grid tore through the vampires like a rabid animal. His health bar plummeted as claws raked his armor and fangs found gaps in his defense. Blood sprayed. The party members scrambled to cover his suicidal assault, struggling to prevent a complete collapse.

***

At Reidan Castle's resurrection point, light flared.

**Pahat!**

Huroi materialized in a burst of white radiance. Considering his body had been shredded apart by Elfin Stone minutes ago, he looked remarkably intact.

"Pant... pant..."

His breathing came in ragged gasps. His entire body trembled. Huroi possessed a strong mentality, but nothing prepares you for the sensation of being hacked to pieces. He forced himself to breathe slowly, methodically shaking off the trauma. Finally, he opened his status window and checked his experience gauge.

*Ten percent.*

The drop was brutal. 29.3% of his total experience, gone. Past level 200, death penalties scaled proportionally with level.

*Fortunately, no items dropped.*

Cold comfort. The durability of all his equipment had decreased by at least 100 points. If Huroi were an ordinary user without access to Grid's crafting, the repair costs would bankrupt him.

"Huroi?"

Lauel jogged over, dark circles visible under his eyes. He was the busiest person in the guild. Exhaustion clung to him like a second skin.

"What happened?"

Lauel knew only two methods to escape a vampire city. Kill the boss or die. If one party member returned alone, the reason was obvious.

"You died." Not a question.

Huroi nodded.

"The boss is too strong."

"Tell me everything."

There was no point hiding details. Huroi recounted the entire encounter in the vampire city. To his surprise, Lauel's reaction was almost cheerful.

"Grid used that method? Haha! Incredible!" Lauel's grin widened. "Grid's brain wasn't just a decoration after all!"

"..."

Lauel seemed genuinely jubilant about Grid's tactical evolution. But the phrasing was tactless enough that Huroi couldn't help glaring.

***

"Grid's expedition to the 13th city will end in failure. By this time tomorrow, Grid's party will respawn at the resurrection point."

Lauel stood at the head of the meeting room table in Reidan Castle. He'd convened the former Tzedakah Guild members to deliver news about Grid's situation. Murmurs rippled through the assembled Overgeared members at the grim report.

Toban ground his teeth together. "I should've gone."

As a paladin with divine power, Toban was the natural counter to vampires. But he'd remained behind to manage the yellow mithril mine. Few people in Overgeared possessed the administrative skills to handle that many workers, making Toban invaluable in logistics.

Lauel waited until the atmosphere settled before continuing.

"As you know, pavranium is indispensable for Grid. The more pavranium Grid obtains, the stronger he becomes. I'm sending two additional people to support Grid's party."

Reidan, Bairan, Cork Island. Managing three territories simultaneously left zero room for flexibility. Even dispatching two people strained Lauel's resources. If he pulled two more members, he'd need to sacrifice sleep entirely just to keep everything running.

Toban stood. "I'm going."

"No. Not you."

"Think about it!" Toban's voice rose. "I'll be the biggest help to Grid's party right now!"

"I'm aware." Lauel's tone remained flat. "But with over 100 miners under your supervision, you can't leave."

"Then what about me?"

Toon, the human beast, leaned forward.

Lauel shook his head. "Not you either. If you leave while the main force is absent, the guild's combat power drops to dangerous levels."

"Then who?"

"Hrmm."

Lauel's gaze swept across the Overgeared members present. Including Huroi, there were three people in the room. Who could provide significant support to Grid's expedition without crippling territory management?

He deliberated before pointing.

"Ibellin."

"Yes!" The flamberge master straightened in his chair, clearly delighted. For the past several days, he'd been relegated to grinding monsters near the mine.

"The second one..." Lauel sighed. "No matter how I look at it, there isn't another useless person like Ibellin."

"You bastard!"

The rivalry between Lauel and Ibellin from their Ten Rookies days remained unresolved. As the two began bickering, someone knocked on the meeting room door.

"Come in."

At Lauel's call, a soldier pushed the door open.

"A guest has arrived."

"A guest?" Lauel frowned. What visitor would come directly to the guild?

"Heok."

"This is ridiculous..."

The Overgeared members stared, shock rippling through the room as they recognized the guest.

"Nice to meet you."

Even her voice was beautiful. Pale skin and black hair. A slender figure and composed bearing that radiated natural charisma. 

Yura.

Lauel's smile stretched wide.

***

"Pant, pant... shit, I'm going to die."

Vantner's armor was caked with dried blood. He cursed between gasps, voice raw. The situation had deteriorated into desperation. Over 100 vampires encircled Grid's current position, including three True Blood vampires.

Grid's eight-person party looked like corpses still standing. Health bars flickered in the red. Mana pools sat empty. Even their stamina gauges had bottomed out, making it difficult to lift their weapons. This was the consequence of grinding without rest.

"It's too much."

"I wanted to punch that bastard Elfin Stone's face in." Pon's laugh was bitter. "Too bad I'll die before getting the chance."

The party members had resigned themselves to the worst outcome. Even Jishuka, who typically encouraged the group through impossible odds, remained silent. Grid watched her chest rise and fall with each labored breath and tightened his grip on Failure.

**Kwajak!**

He squeezed out his remaining strength and swung at a vampire's skull. The blow drew every vampire's attention. Their eyes locked onto Grid simultaneously.

"Crazy!"

"Hey! The leader can't die first! We should die protecting you!"

The terrified party scrambled toward Grid's position.

"Pant... pant..."

Grid said nothing. He kept gasping for air as he swung his swords at the approaching vampires. The only mercy was that Lifael's Spear hovered beside him, unaffected by physical exhaustion. Without the divine weapon's autonomous support, Grid would have fallen minutes ago.

"Sigh. One last rampage."

Vantner was galvanized by Grid's suicidal determination. He raised his shield despite having already burned his invincibility skill hours ago. His defensive skills sat on cooldown. Potions? He'd been chugging them the moment they came off cooldown. The other members were in identical states.

"Die!"

The vampires launched their final assault. The three True Blood vampires led the charge. Vantner tried to intercept with his shield but was simply overpowered, forced backward. The other party members managed to kill two or three vampires each before reaching their absolute limits. They failed to block subsequent attacks. Their health plummeted toward zero.

"Jishuka!"

Enemies broke through the collapsed front line and targeted Jishuka. Zednos squeezed out the last dregs of his mana, but the wind magic proved too weak to save her. This was the end.

"Hah... hah..."

The party could only wait for death. The vampires closed in to deliver the killing blows.

**Chaaeng!**

A brilliant pillar of light erupted upward. The unmistakable signal of a level-up. And that someone was naturally...

"You've been waiting."

Grid.

> [Congratulations!]
> 
> [You have reached level 300 and achieved the third stats awakening!]
> 
> [For every point of stamina, health will increase by 25 and defense will increase by 0.9.]
> 
> [For every point of strength, health will increase by 7 and attack will increase by 0.6.]
> 
> [For every point of intelligence...]

...

...

> [One of Pagma's Descendant's hidden pieces 'Sealed Ability' has been acquired.]
> 
> [The skill 'Item Combination' has been acquired.]
